docs.lead_paragraph: Even as President Barack Obama tries to make a hard case for overhauling sentences, rehabilitating prisoners and confronting racial bias in policing, he has been less clear about the death penalty.

docs.abstract: Profile of presidential candidate Carly Fiorina, whose upbringing set her on course toward conservative politics, enjoying many privileges that could prove liability in today's Republican climate favoring anti-establishment outsiders; Fiorina's father was esteemed conservative law professor Joseph Tyree Sneed III.

headline.print_headline: Fiorina’s Family Pedigree and Peripatetic Childhood Built Her Worldview
headline.main: For Carly Fiorina, Peripatetic Childhood Helped Build Worldview

docs.abstract: Maureen Dowd Op-Ed column offers views of her Republican brother Kevin on 2016 presidential election.

docs.lead_paragraph: The senator’s plan starts with the right premise: that immigrants should be welcomed and assimilated, not criminalized and exploited.
docs.snippet: The senator’s plan starts with the right premise: that immigrants should be welcomed and assimilated, not criminalized and exploited....
docs.abstract: Editorial praises immigration reform plan set forth by 2016 presidential contender Sen Bernie Sanders; holds Sanders offers reasonable proposal for how to protect and honor immigrant families while bolstering both economy and rule of law; contends Sanders's reality-based and practical approach, backed by specific policy ideas, offers level-headed counterpoint to hysteria whipped up by Republicans.

headline.main: Bernie Sanders Gets Immigration Policy Right

docs.lead_paragraph: Escalating drug prices and now a major company’s pending move overseas leads to concern about “too much obvious greed” in the pharmaceutical industry.
docs.snippet: Escalating drug prices and now a major company’s pending move overseas leads to concern about “too much obvious greed” in the pharmaceutical industry....
docs.abstract: Drugmaker Pfizer's decision to merge with Allergan and move its headquarters to Ireland has shaken industry lobbyists, who see potential to damage industry and create backlash against it; Obama administration and both Republican and Democratic members of Congress have pressed for tax-code reform that would prohibit practice, known as 'corporate inversion,' that allows companies to pay foreign taxes rather than higher American rates.

headline.print_headline: Pfizer’s Plan to Leave U.S. Unsettles Drug Lobbyists
headline.main: Pfizer’s Plan to Leave U.S. Unsettles Drug Lobbyists
